fields.description: Provide wizard to create new ELB.

comments.body:
The branch GUI-1484 is ready for UX review.

There are 2 things that are different from the wire frame.

One is that the step 1 of the create ELB wizard is missing the tag section. Previously it was noted that the support of the tags on ELB was in question, thus left out in the initial development.

Second thing to mention is that the alignment of the input fields are displayed differently on the wizard. The input labels and the fields are displayed inline on the implementation while the wire frame shows that the labels and the fields to be displayed in two rows separately. The rendering of the input label and input fields are done by the server-side templating, thus the format for the input field display is set for inline configuration at the moment. If the display to be done in separately lines, then it would require manually setting up each input field on the template directly.

Please let me know if you see any other discrepancies on the implementation and the wire frame.

Thank you!

Kyo
non-functional at the moment, but the tag editor has been added to the create ELB wizard in the current GUI-1484 branch.
Adding tags on ELB works now.

FYI, the template used for the input fields is,

templates/panels/form_field_row.pt

, which is used for all server-generated input elements in forms.

hi [~kyolee], [~dkavanagh] hsa figured out a way to stack labels on widgets int he wizards, he did it for the name in the create stack wizard. Please consult him for tips and fix that. may need input from [~kgill] as well.

Also, I opened this quickly and noticed many things do not have the correct classes applied for styling. Please look at other wizards and other panels to mimic styling for things like section headers, subsection headers, add a whatever widget labels etc. 

Please check your styling against other wizards that have been completed and be sure you are using the same classes. I'll do a proper UX review once that is corrected, I don't wantt o have to point out every violation individually here.

[~jloza], what [~dkavanagh] has done on the name label of the stack wizard is what I meant by the "manual setup". Since most of the input elements on the create ELB wizard are in such format, it'd be better if we could handle the layout using the server template option.

The branch has been updated to match the classes on the create ELB wizard.

The form field template has been updated to support the stack label.

* breadcrumb should use same resource name as we call it everywhere else in the console. Not abbreviation
* same for page title, we don't say elastic anywhere
* styling for "add a listener" is still not right. Attention to detail! Look at "add a tag" it's right there on the same page!
* I can select negative values for ports until i change focus. 
* port validation message needs grammar help. must be "a whole number" please instead of "whole numbers"
* listener table is not styled like other tables. look at BDM editor in instance launch wizard for correct styling. It also can take up more room and spread wider, there's loads of unnecessary whitespace on both sides of it. 
* instances tab is completely insane, both visually and behaviorally. I can't review it until it come closer to the wireframe. You can't possibly think this is shippable? Screenshot attached. stopping review of the rest of the wizard until these problems are addressed. Please find me if you have questions while working on this BEFORE submitting for review again. Ask [~kgill]
*  if you have implementation questions or need help, especially with the template issue, as I mentioned previously.

[~jloza] Please understand that when submitting for the first iteration UX review on a new major feature, from a developer's perspective, what is expected out of the UX review is the validation the usability and functionality of the component. I do not expect this feature to be immediately "shippable", as you worded, at this point of the development.

The question is that I'd like to ask instead is that, are those issues, that mention in the previous comment, such critical that they should be delaying the code to be reviewed and blocking this feature branch to be merged into the master branch? Understand that currently there are other ELB tasks that depend on this branch to be merged. 

The majority of the UX issues that you brought up previously are related to the seemingly minor, non-critical appearance issue that can be easily addressed in the later stage of the development. In other words, fixing those issues would be rather trivial, non-interruptive, to the overall design pattern, architecture, and implementation of the component that they shouldn't serve as blockers for this branch to be merged into the master.

Another point to bring up is that the comment such as "instances tab is completely insane, both visually and behaviorally." provides no useful information for me to carry onto action. Please be more descriptive and precise when addressing the issues so that I won't have to further guess the problems after the review.

Thank you,

Kyo

[~kyolee], In order to pass UX review, the code must behave the way the wireframe specifies, and be styled correctly. This branch cannot be merged until UX review is passed. The amount of fixes required at this time is too large to consider this branch ready for code review. This expectation is the same for you as it is for any developer working on the console. 

The instances tab does not match the behavioral specification of the wireframe, and the table is not visually correct either, as shown in the attachment. Please review the wireframe carefully for behavioral requirements, and use another previously implemented table as guidance for styling and layout of the table you are implementing.

Update of the branch GUI-1484:

* The breadcrumb was adjusted to use "load balancers"
* The page title was adjusted to use "Create new load balancer"
* The styling for "add a listener" has been updated.
* The validation of the negative values on the port input gets activated after the user finishes typing, which takes a few millisecond delay. This is Foundation's behavior on the input validation. No fix was added. 
* The port validation message has been updated.
* The listener table' style has been updated.
* The instances tab page's behavior has been updated.

The branch has been updated after the UX review. See the comment above for the update list.

This ticket is currently blocking the progress of the ticket GUI-1483 ELB detail page.

The UX and code review of this branch is needed to be performed immediately.
Every effort is made to review all tickets that go into UX review within 24 hours (or the next working day if they are submitted outside of normal business hours).

The features implemented, and submitted for review, on the branch GUI-1484 include what was described in the wireframe during Sprint 1 and Sprint 2. Other added features, such as the updated certificate related features and the access log, will be implemented in separate tickets.

The branch GUI-1484 has been updated to add a new fix:

* on VPC system, the VPC subnet chosen widget fails to update when instances are selected due to the incorrect default VPC value.

General tab:
* Add a listener label is missing a colon
* Add Listener button is too large, see tag editor for example 
* added certificate, name did not display next to certificates label or in table
* listener table does not use specified delete icon
* listener table header lacking vertical line separators as shown in wireframe
* adding a second listener seemed to add the certificate I had selected the first time through. See screenshot. 
* user is allowed to click Next while partially specifying listener without clicking add listener, no warning dialog displayed (see tag widget for example)

Certificate dialog:
* All words in text block need a space between them
* cert name lacking required field indicator

Instances tab: 
* Remove tags from facets, please. MSB can't support them, this was updated recently.
* For euca, the user does not have to select instances. They can just enable zones and select instances later, according to comments in the wireframe from [~spark]
* x-zone balancing checkbox should be checked by default

Health Check tab:
* tab title does not match wireframe
* please add some whitespace between the text block and the first section header, it's too tightly spaced now. For an example of whitespace between text block and widgets, see the instances tab of scaling group details page. 
* protocols in dropdown are not in the specified order, please use the same order as in the listener widget
* advanced settings should not be indented 
* whitespace is also too tight above subsection headers under advanced section, and above advanced section header. Please match the whitespace you are adjusting for the first section header. 
* Also, more whitespace needed above h-rule under advanced section. 

Create button text should not include "Elastic"

[~kyolee], I did not have timely access to a VPN-enabled back end and so will review that content and behavior on the next round. I wanted to get you these comments today so You could go ahead and address them.

General tab:
* Add a listener label is missing a colon -- fixed
* Add Listener button is too large, see tag editor for example  -- fixed
* added certificate, name did not display next to certificates label or in table
      --> Couldn't reproduce. When added a new certificate, the table showed updated certificate name. Need more detailed condition for this issue.
      --> If the added certificate is for backend, it won't show on the elb listener table, nor on the summary.
* listener table does not use specified delete icon  - fixed
* listener table header lacking vertical line separators as shown in wireframe  - fixed
* adding a second listener seemed to add the certificate I had selected the first time through. See screenshot.
      --> there can be only one certificate selected for the load balancer in the current implementation.
* user is allowed to click Next while partially specifying listener without clicking add listener, no warning dialog displayed (see tag widget for example) -- fixed.

Certificate dialog:
* All words in text block need a space between them  -- fixed
* cert name lacking required field indicator  -- fixed

Instances tab:
* Remove tags from facets, please. MSB can't support them, this was updated recently.  -- fixed
* For euca, the user does not have to select instances. They can just enable zones and select instances later, according to comments in the wireframe from Sang-Min Park  - fixed
* x-zone balancing checkbox should be checked by default  - fixed

Health Check tab:
* tab title does not match wireframe  - fixed
* please add some whitespace between the text block and the first section header, it's too tightly spaced now. For an example of whitespace between text block and widgets, see the instances tab of scaling group details page.   -- fixed
* protocols in dropdown are not in the specified order, please use the same order as in the listener widget  -- fixed
* advanced settings should not be indented  - fixed
* whitespace is also too tight above subsection headers under advanced section, and above advanced section header. Please match the whitespace you are adjusting for the first section header.  -- fixed
* Also, more whitespace needed above h-rule under advanced section.  -- fixed
* Create button text should not include "Elastic"  -- fixed

The branch GUI-1484 has been updated to address the issues after the UX review.

See the comment above for the update list.

The only 2 issues that were not addressed on this commit are below:

- added certificate, name did not display next to certificates label or in table

- adding a second listener seemed to add the certificate I had selected the first time through. See screenshot.

The current implementation on the SSL certificate, backend certificate, and cipher selection is rather incomplete since these features are tracked by different tickets, GUI-1486 and GUI-GUI-1699

General tab: 
* validation error message "spaces" should be plural
* table delete icon should be gray not green, see BDM table for example
* vertical line in table header is too dark gray, should be same gray as line that separates rows
* table says "no certs" when secure protocol is defined when there should be no text there if no cert is selected
* validation error message when a second listener is defined using same ports as first one should be located directly under widget that defines ports. Also, the message is not clear. Please use this text: "Selected port already in use by another listener. Please select an unused port."
* The modal box added when a listener is partially defined does not have enough padding at the top and the text is overlapping the close button. See add tag again for example of padding. 
* Also, I realized that the listener panel has so many fields it's a pain to clear them if you don't want to add the listener that was partially defined, so I added a "Cancel" button to the wireframe, please add that.
* When I cleared the fields in the listener panel, the validation error message remained. The Next button became enabled but clicking it does not advance me to the next screen. Screenshot attached. 

Network tab:
* inconsistent spacing between labels and fields 
* Inconsistent field height between single chosen and multi-chosen. I know [~dkavanagh]
*  has fixed this for some of his stuff, please check with him for pointers. 

Instances tab (VPC):
* Both "add" labels should be using the same class as other field labels


Instances tab (global): 
* Please be sure you are using the latest MSB code, see [~dkavanagh] for details. Text search is not displaying correctly in MSB (missing "text", see screenshot. There may be no action required here but please confirm. 
* * help bubbles for "add" labels are spaced too far away from their labels (match spacing for x-zone help bubble)

Health check tab:
* protocols in dropdown still do not match listener panel

Summary pane:
* all labels need to be sentence case, some are title case. 
* VPC subnets are not displaying in the correct place
* x-zone balancing should not be included here

Certificates and x-zone stuff (other than summary) not included in this review.
for MSB, once GUI-1472 is merged, the latest will be available.

[~dkavanagh] How did you address the issue below?

 - Inconsistent field height between single chosen and multi-chosen. I know David Kavanagh
has fixed this for some of his stuff, please check with him for pointers.

All the issues from the UX review have been addressed in the current branch.

GUi-1484 is ready for UX review.

almost there. 

Network tab: tags inside multi-chosen are not vertically centered in the field. See attached screenshot.

instance tab field labels still not correct.

GUI-1484 has been updated:

Setting the CSS height on the security group chosen widget causes issues when the widget is expanded. Instead, the chosen widget has been applied to both VPC network and security group fields to match the look on the network tab page.

The instance tab page's labels have been adjusted.

VPC Network should not be a Chosen widget, that is reserved for lists which require searching. I misspoke when I referred to this widget as Chosen in my previous comment rather than a Foundation dropdown...if you had asked me to clarify it could have avoided unnecessary work on your part. Please return this widget to Foundation dropdown, and ensure that the height of the multi-chosen widget in your branch is consistent with other places it is used in the console.

Instances tab field labels wrong on third try. Do not resubmit this ticket for review without discussing this with me first.

The branch GUI-1484 is ready for UX review:

-- reverted the chosen widget on the VPC network filed. The select element height issue is tracked on the ticket GUI-1724

-- adjusted the label style on the instance tab page

Update:

 -- Merged the latest 'master' branch into GUI-1484
 -- Updated the helptext icon to match the view from the stack wizard helptext icon

Back to inconsistent padding between labels and fields on network tab again. Please be sure padding between VPC network and associated widget is the same as what's defined for the security groups label and its associated widget. Screenshot attached.
The padding issue, due to the chosen initialization, is tracked on the ticket https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-1724.

The chosen widget's padding issue has been added to the ticket

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-1724

UX review passed, please note that many aspects of this wizard are tracked in separate Jira tickets, and so while they may not pass UX review now, I am holding full review of those things until the associated tickets come through. 

Ready for code review

Pull request is created at

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1375
Punting back to implement fixes from PR comments
The branch GUI-1484 has been updated after the code review.
[~kgill] The module name has been updated to BaseELBWizard, and the branch is ready for review.
[~kyolee]: We'll need to resolve the merge conflicts in PR 1375, which I suspect were caused by the recent merge of https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1368

[~kgill] Resolved the merge conflict issue, and created tickets for the custom_filters.js cleanup issue, https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-1729, and the ELB unit-test coverage, https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-1730
PR 1375 merged
Released in 4.2
